pull.title: qa: quote path in authproxy for external multiwallets
pull.body:
When using external multiwallets they are specified by their full path which might contain non-ascii characters (e.g. umlauts or emojis).

Fix this by url-quoting the path.

events.body:

events.message: qa: Quote wallet name for rpc path

events.body:
Quoted the wallet name as per @laanwj.

Can be tested with `./test/functional/wallet_multiwallet.py --tmpdir=tempðŸ‘›001`

Re-tested fa67505 using `./test/functional/wallet_multiwallet.py --tmpdir=tempðŸ‘›001` from above.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -102,6 +102,7 @@ def _request(self, method, path, postdata):
                    'User-Agent': USER_AGENT,
                    'Authorization': self.__auth_header,
                    'Content-type': 'application/json'}
+        path = urllib.parse.quote(path)
comments.body: I'm not sure this is the correct place to do URL-quoting (in general, you never want to url-quote a path, just path **components**). Wouldn't the best place to this be where the path is generated?

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -102,6 +102,7 @@ def _request(self, method, path, postdata):
                    'User-Agent': USER_AGENT,
                    'Authorization': self.__auth_header,
                    'Content-type': 'application/json'}
+        path = urllib.parse.quote(path)

@@ -102,6 +102,7 @@ def _request(self, method, path, postdata):
                    'User-Agent': USER_AGENT,
                    'Authorization': self.__auth_header,
                    'Content-type': 'application/json'}
+        path = urllib.parse.quote(path)
comments.body: Indeed, we woulndn't want to double-quote in case the path is already quoted.
